title: Navigation firm TomTom posts higher first-quarter core earnings, beats estimate
text:
April 17, 2018 / 5:19 AM / Updated 15 minutes ago Navigation firm TomTom posts higher first-quarter core earnings, beats estimate Reuters Staff 1 Min Read 
AMSTERDAM (Reuters) - TomTom ( TOM2.AS ), the Dutch navigation and mapping company, reported on Tuesday better-than-expected first-quarter core earnings, despite a decline in sales. FILE PHOTO: TomTom navigation are seen in the car in this illustration taken July 28, 2017. REUTERS/Dado Ruvic/File Photo 
The company’s earnings before interest, taxes, depreciation and amortisation (EBITDA) came in at 43 million euros (£37.1 million), compared with average expectations of 34 million euros in a company-published poll, unchanged from the first quarter of 2017. 
Sales dropped by 10 percent to 192 million euros as the company’s personal navigation device business continued to shrink. Reporting by Toby Sterling, Editing by Sherry Jacob-Phillips
